member this.CreateDatabase : System.Data.Common.DbConnection * Nullable<int> * System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection -> unit

Docs.param: Connection to a non-existent database that needs to be created and populated with the store objects indicated with the storeItemCollection parameter.
Execution timeout for any commands needed to create the database.
The collection of all store items based on which the script should be created.

MemberSignature.Value: public string CreateDatabaseScript (string providerManifestToken, System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);
.method public hidebysig instance string CreateDatabaseScript(string providerManifestToken, class System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection) cil managed
member this.CreateDatabaseScript : string * System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection -> string

Docs.param: The provider manifest token identifying the target version.
The structure of the database.
Docs.summary: Generates a data definition language (DDL script that creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.
Docs.returns: A DDL script that creates schema objects based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.
Docs.remarks: Individual statements should be separated using database-specific DDL command separator. It is expected that the generated script would be executed in the context of existing database with sufficient permissions, and it should not include commands to create the database, but it may include commands to create schemas and other auxiliary objects such as sequences, etc.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object GetService (Type type, object key);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetService(class System.Type type, object key) cil managed
abstract member GetService : Type * obj -> obj override this.GetService : Type * obj -> obj

Docs.param: The type of the service to be resolved.
An optional key providing additional information for resolving the service.
Docs.summary: Called to resolve additional default provider services when a derived type is registered as an EF provider either using an entry in the application's config file or through code-based registration in . The implementation of this method in this class uses the resolvers added with the AddDependencyResolver method to resolve dependencies.
Docs.returns: An instance of the given type, or null if the service could not be resolved.
Docs.remarks: Use this method to set, add, or change other provider-related services. Note that this method will only be called for such services if they are not already explicitly configured in some other way by the application. This allows providers to set default services while the application is still able to override and explicitly configure each service if required. See and for more details.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<object> GetServices (Type type, object key);

abstract member GetServices : Type * obj -> seq<obj> override this.GetServices : Type * obj -> seq<obj>

Docs.param: The type of the service to be resolved.
An optional key providing additional information for resolving the service.
Docs.summary: Called to resolve additional default provider services when a derived type is registered as an EF provider either using an entry in the application's config file or through code-based registration in . The implementation of this method in this class uses the resolvers added with the AddDependencyResolver method to resolve dependencies.
Docs.returns: All registered services that satisfy the given type and key, or an empty enumeration if there are none.
